meanings.definition: Having more advantages or opportunities than others.
meanings.sent1: The overprivileged child had many toys to play with.
meanings.sent2: She felt overprivileged compared to her classmates who had less.
meanings.sent3: The overprivileged puppy had a bed in every room of the house.
meanings.sent4: The overprivileged student never knew the struggle of not having enough.
meanings.sent5: The overprivileged family lived in a mansion with a pool and tennis court.

meanings.definition: To grant excessive privileges or advantages to someone.
meanings.sent1: The teacher overprivileged the student by giving him extra time on the test.
meanings.sent2: Parents should be careful not to overprivileged their children, as it can hinder their development.
meanings.sent3: The coach accidentally overprivileged the star player by letting him skip practice.
meanings.sent4: The company decided to overprivileged the CEO with a huge bonus for his work.
meanings.sent5: The king would often overprivileged his favorite courtiers with lavish gifts and titles.
